result.execSummary:
The defendant Kaitlin J. Hewitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: AODA/treatment per agnet.  Participation in and compliance with Sauk Co. Drug Court Program.

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  No contact w/B.Y. or J.Y.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Absolute Sobriety of alcohol & controlled substances.
**Defendant has 111 days jail credit if probation revoked**.  
ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.
Upon successful completion of probation, record may be expunged, 973.015.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kaitlin J. Hewitt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Kaitlin J. Hewitt
Current: 1817 Crawford Street, Baraboo, WI 53913 United States  (Effective: 03-29-2017)
Prior: 32456 State Hwy 80, c/o Juliana Meyers, Muscoda, WI 53573 United States
judgment for unpaid fines, forfeitures and other financial obligations  (remailed to new address as provided by Gina)

Defendant Kaitlin J. Hewitt in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Defendant Kaitlin J. Hewitt in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and State states appearances.  State states resolution.  Parties discuss participation in SCDCP.  Parties agree to recess until 1pm to discuss the matter.  Back on the record at 1:11 pm.  Counsel has now had the chance to discuss the drug court condition and what it may look like.  State states they would agree to the language of "enrollment in and complaince with the requirements of the SCDCP".  Court makes small change to language.  Atty O'Rourke and DE are in agreement.  Court questions parties re: restitution.  Atty O'Rourke enters NC pleas to Cts 2 and 3 in 15CF350 and Ct 1 in 15CM416.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  Court reviews VIS in each case.  State makes statement.  Atty O'Rourke makes statement.  DE makes brief statement.  Court finds due to the amount of work that went into this recommendation that he is comfortable proceeding w/o the usual information he would require prior to sentencing.  Court sentences.  DE advised of felony firearms possession and voting rights.  Court notes DE will have some jail credit due to her if she should ever be revoked.  Parties discuss.  Parties are in agreement that the DE would have 111 days credit.

15CF350
Cts 2 and 3:  NC
Ct 2:  36 months probation 
$518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
Ct 3:  24 months probation concurrent to Ct 2
$443.00 costs/surcharges and $10.00 property crime surcharge to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
Restitution per stip filed today to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan w/the Clerk of Courts Office
Cts 1 and 4:  Dismissed/read-in
111 days sentence credit to be applied if probation would be revoked

Conditions of probation:
DNA sample to be provided
Participation in and complaince w/Sauk County Drug Court Program (SCDCP)
AODA/Treatment and any other treatment/counseling per agent
Absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances w/o valid prescription
No contact w/B.Y. or J.Y.
If successful on probation the case is to be expunged


15CM416
Ct 1:  NC
Probation for one year concurrent to 15CF350 probation
Conditions of probation:
$443.00 costs/surcharges and $10.00 property crime surcharge to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
All other conditions the same as in 15CF350
If successful on probation the case is to be expunged

Defendant Kaitlin J. Hewitt appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Deb ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State requests $500 Cash bond. Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $500.00 Signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/MB., his residence or outbuildings; No contact w/co actor B.Y.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.
